titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Alumni
titleInfo.subTitle: Lloyd Funchess oral history interview, 1976

name.description: Faculty member of Louisiana State University, composer of the LSU alma mater, and supervisor of music for the Louisiana State Dept. of Education.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.).--School of Music.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by interviewee and interviewer and/or their heirs in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Interview concerns the composition of the LSU alma mater and Funchess's work at LSU as bandmaster (1925), teacher at the School of Music (1929), and faculty member (1930-1937); and as Louisiana state supervisor of music.
